metadata.title: USN-6393-1 -- ImageMagick vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ImageMagick did not properly handle memory when processing the -help option. An attacker could potentially use this issue to cause a crash.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6393-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-6.q16-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 imagemagick-doc - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickwand-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagick++-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagick++-6.q16-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickwand-6.q16-dev - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
